title: In Berlin, King Charles Lauds Germany’s Support for Ukraine
description: “Together we must be vigilant against threats to our values,” the British monarch said to German lawmakers.

title: Five Arrested in Migration Center Fire That Left 39 Dead in Mexico
description: The authorities said arrest warrants had been obtained for three government migration officials, two private security workers and a migrant accused of starting the blaze.

title: 6 U.S. Service Members Suffered Traumatic Brain Injuries in Syria Attacks
description: The Pentagon said the injuries were diagnosed during routine screenings in the days after the strikes by Iranian-backed militants.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Trump Indicted
description: Also, an American journalist arrested in Russia and a Chinese billionaire’s downfall.

title: In Arrest of US Reporter, Russia Doubles Down on Isolation From West
description: The Kremlin, which accused a Wall Street Journal correspondent of being a spy, made a move not seen since the Cold War, further raising the barriers between Russia and the West.

title: Days After Netanyahu Fires Him, Israel’s Defense Minister Is Still on the Job
description: Yoav Gallant, Israel’s defense minister, was fired on Sunday, setting off unrest, but Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu never formally confirmed his dismissal.

title: U.S. Puts Sanctions on Man Accused of Working on Russia-North Korea Arms Deal
description: The White House said the man would be in violation of several U.N. Security Council resolutions.

title: Kushner’s Firm Was Backed by Investments From the Emirates and Qatar
description: The infusion of money from interests in the two Persian Gulf monarchies reflects the close ties to Middle Eastern nations established by Jared Kushner, former President Donald Trump’s son-in-law.

title: At Least 14 Are Killed in India When a Temple’s Well Cover Collapses
description: Rescuers struggled to reach many other Hindu worshipers who were trapped and injured in a packed temple in Indore during a religious festival.

title: Vatican Repudiates ‘Doctrine of Discovery,’ Used as Justification for Colonization
description: Indigenous communities have long called on the Vatican rescind the concept, which had been used over the centuries to seize land from people in the Americas, Africa and elsewhere.

title: Macron, Trying to Move Past Pension Fury, Announces Water Plan
description: President Emmanuel Macron of France presented conservation proposals after an exceptionally dry winter. But his government is still dogged by pension protests.

title: Bankers Are Convicted of Allowing a Putin Ally to Deposit Millions in Swiss Accounts
description: The accounts were opened in the name of Sergei P. Roldugin, a concert cellist nicknamed “Putin’s wallet.”

title: A.I., Brain Scans and Cameras: The Spread of Police Surveillance Tech
description: In the Middle East, artificial intelligence and other emerging technologies have become part of everyday policing.

title: Police Missteps Contributed to Canada’s Deadliest Shooting Rampage, Inquiry Says
description: A commission found there was confusion, poor communication and inflexible thinking among the police during a 13-hour rampage in 2020 in which 23 people died.

title: Studies Link Common Childhood Viruses to Rare Hepatitis Cases
description: Infection with multiple common viruses may be responsible for the cases that puzzled doctors last year.

title: Sailboat Crew Rescued After Hitting Whale in Pacific Ocean
description: After the collision in the Pacific Ocean this month, Rick Rodriguez and three other sailors were rescued by a fellow boater, with an assist from a satellite internet signal.

title: Why This Colombian Town Still Celebrates Christmas in February
description: The Afro-Colombian residents of Quinamayó have followed a unique tradition: celebrating Christmas 40 days after the traditional date, a custom begun under the subjugation of slavery.

title: Pope ‘Gradually Improving’ After First Night in the Hospital
description: Few details were available about the condition of Pope Francis, 86, and it was too early to determine whether he would be able to attend several Easter-related ceremonies.

title: Bolsonaro Returns to Brazil, Ending Self-Imposed Exile
description: The former president returned to a tense political landscape in which he is under investigation for spreading election misinformation and for inspiring the Jan. 8 attack in the capital.

title: A Mexican Grandmother Finds the Right Recipe for Culinary Stardom
description: Through her YouTube videos, Doña Ángela has become among the most watched and beloved cooks in the crowded market of online food shows. But what explains her widespread popularity?

title: The Biggest Battle in Ukraine
description: Why Russia and Ukraine are fighting for a city with little strategic value.

title: Turkey Is Likely to Clear the Way for Finland to Join NATO
description: Turkey’s Parliament is expected to approve Finland’s bid to join NATO, its final hurdle to membership in the alliance.

title: A Shepherd, a Cook, a Palace Chef: Making Food With Less Under the Taliban
description: In a time of famine and money shortages, meals are a rallying point — and a topic of worry — during a season of change in Afghanistan.

title: Ukraine Goes Dark: NASA Images Drive Home a Nation’s Anguish
description: A satellite operated by NASA and NOAA bares how Russia’s drones and missiles knocked out the nation’s power.

title: Ukrainians Directing Soldiers From a Hidden Hub See Bakhmut Going Their Way
description: Ukrainian commanders say they have exhausted Russia’s relentless assaults on the eastern city, though soldiers say the cost in lives has been steep.

title: Ukrainians Directing Soldiers From a Hidden Hub See Bakhmut Going Their Way
description: Ukrainian commanders say they have exhausted Russia’s relentless assaults on the eastern city, though soldiers say the cost in lives has been steep.

title: Russia Detains a Wall Street Journal Reporter, Accusing Him of Espionage
description: Russia’s F.S.B. security service said that the American journalist Evan Gershkovich was detained in Yekaterinburg, a city in Russia’s Ural Mountains.

title: Indonesia Stripped of Under-20 World Cup After Israel Protests
description: Preparations for the tournament were thrown into disarray when a governor asked Indonesia’s sports ministry to bar Israel’s team from participating.

title: Tokyo Olympics Scandal Fouls Hopes for a Sapporo Winter Games
description: The International Olympic Committee was already struggling to find hosts for the Winter Games. Sapporo’s flailing 2030 bid has added another headache.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Fears grow about Ukraine’s imperiled nuclear plant.

title: Philippines Ferry Fire Kills at Least 10
description: The vessel caught fire near an island in the southern province of Basilan, the coast guard said. The cause was not immediately clear.

title: Mexico Investigates Migrant Deaths in Border City Fire as Homicide Case
description: The authorities identified eight suspects and said government workers and private security workers had done nothing to help migrants flee the blaze at a detention center in Ciudad Juárez.
